customer_addr:
18609 SE State Route Y
DEARBORN, MO 64439

citations.narrative:
There is a strong ammonia odor within the building. The most concentrated smell (make you catch your breath) is located
in the portion housing the hedgehogs. Ventilation was observed; however, the building is small with a significant number
of animals (to include 23 guinea pigs) and used litter pans. Poor ventilation can negatively impact the animal’s respiratory
function, aid in the spread of disease, increase odors and cause physical discomfort, all of which affect the health and
well-being of the animals.
Licensee must ensure that indoor housing facilities are effectively ventilated by natural or mechanical means to minimize
odors, spread of disease, and improve the overall air quality for the health and well-being of the animals.
* To be corrected by: 11/7/2023

There is a strong ammonia odor throughout the building. The most concentrated smell (make you catch your breath) is
located in the portion housing the hedgehog and rabbit enclosures.. Ventilation was observed; however, the building is
small with a significant number of animals (to include 24 rabbits) and used litter pans. Poor ventilation can negatively
impact the animal’s respiratory function, aid in the spread of disease, increase odors and cause physical discomfort, all of
which affect the health and well-being of the animals.
Licensee must ensure that indoor housing facilities are effectively ventilated by natural or mechanical means to minimize
odors, spread of disease, and improve the overall air quality for the health and well-being of the rabbits.
* To be corrected by: 11/7/2023

There is a strong ammonia odor within the building. The most concentrated smell (make you catch your breath) is located
in the portion housing the hedgehogs. Ventilation was observed; however, the building is small with a significant number
of animals and used litter pans. Poor ventilation can negatively impact the animal’s respiratory function, aid in the spread
of disease, increase odors and cause physical discomfort, all of which affect the health and well-being of the animals.
Licensee must ensure that indoor housing facilities are effectively ventilated by natural or mechanical means to minimize
odors, spread of disease, and improve the overall air quality for the health and well-being of the animals.

An enclosure containing six hedgehogs has an exercise wheel that has caked on excreta and bedding. A significant
number of gnats were also observed to be flying around that enclosure. The hedgehogs are in contact with the affected
surface area when they use the exercise wheel. Accumulations of fecal or waste matter can increase disease
transmission, create odors, and attract pests, which negatively affects the health of the animals. Adequate cleaning is a
crucial aspect of animal husbandry and helps to reduce disease hazards, odors and pests. The licensee must ensure that
excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the animals, to
minimize disease hazards and to reduce odors and pests.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
n
